summary.p: [1] The letter [No. 2778] sent with this note was entrusted by Blarer to his cousin Konrad Zwick [who was traveling to Zurich]. However, Zwick forgot to deliver it.

[2] Zwick shares that Bullinger can view a copy of the letter [written in the name of the Konstanz council] [to the Four Cities] with the Zurich city clerk [Hans Escher vom Luchs]. He did not get around to copying it for Bullinger. He must already be on a business trip again.

[3] A delegation from the Bishop of Konstanz, Johann von Weeze, appeared today before the Konstanz council. They warned them and said that the bishop was ready to negotiate with Emperor Charles V in favor of Konstanz. May the people of Konstanz remain steadfast!

div.p: I sent this letter to you with my cousin. He forgot it in his bag; I am sending it now.
I should inform you that you will find a copy of his proposal with your city clerk. He did not have time to copy it. He must ride away again immediately.

Our bishop had his delegation appear before the council today, warned my lords, etc., and also declared that he would gladly be a negotiator with the imperial majesty; and he means it all sincerely and fatherly, etc. Oh eternal God, give heart and strength, that we may remain steadfast!
